title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the country
byline: The Meteorology Department says the low pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal is currently located to the east of the Sri Lanka, and it is expected to gradually move west-northwestwards.

title: Syrian mass graves expose “machinery of death” under Assad, top prosecutor says
byline: An international war crimes prosecutor said on Tuesday that evidence emerging from mass grave sites in Syria has exposed a state-run “machinery of death” under toppled leader Bashar al-Assad in which he estimated more than 100,000 people were tortured and murdered since 2013.

title: President returns to island after India visit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake returned to the island yesterday (17) after successfully concluding a three-day official visit to India, according to President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Adani Group dealings with other countries not Sri Lanka’s concern – President
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said his government is not concerned with Adani Group’s dealings with other countries, but is instead focused only on what the conglomerate does in Sri Lanka.

title: Former president Ranil hails Sri Lanka-India joint statement
byline: Former president Ranil Wickremesinghe on Tuesday hailed the joint statement issued by India and Sri Lanka during the island’s President Anura Kumara Disanayaka’s visit to India, saying it will further deepen bilateral cooperation.

title: Nizam Kariapper sworn in as MP
byline: Nizam Kariapper of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) was sworn in as a Member of Parliament during the parliamentary session that commenced today (18).

title: Large scale foreign employment scam uncovered
byline: Information has been revealed regarding a financial scam falsely promising foreign employment, carried out using photographs of officials of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE).

title: Fertilizer subsidies for coconut plantation owners
byline: Deputy Minister Samantha Vidyarathna announced plans to provide fertilizer subsidies to coconut plantation owners as a measure to resolve the prevailing coconut shortage in the country.

title: Harsha de Silva appointed COPF chairman
byline: SJB Member of Parliament, Dr. Harsha de Silva has been appointed as the Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF).

title: CPPCC’s Vice-Chairwoman calls on PM Harini
byline: The Vice-Chairwoman of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) at the Vice Premier Level, Ms. Qin Boyong, has paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, at the Parliament of Sri Lanka.

title: Grade 5 Exam paper leak: CID ordered to submit report tomorrow
byline: The Supreme Court has directed the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to submit a comprehensive report on the ongoing investigation into the leaking of three questions from the first question paper of the recent Grade 5 Scholarship Examination.

title: President participates in parliamentary proceedings
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament a short while ago and is currently taking part in the ongoing parliamentary proceedings, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Govt aims to raise foreign reserves to $15.1 billion by 2028 – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the government’s aim is to raise the country’s foreign exchange reserves to USD 15.1 billion by the year 2028.

title: Govt to raise PAYE tax threshold to Rs. 150,000 – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the government was able to reach an agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to increase the Pay As You Earn (PAYE) Tax exemption limit from Rs. 100,000 to Rs. 150,000.

title: Pope assassination plot foiled by UK intelligence
byline: A plot to assassinate Pope Francis during a trip to Iraq was stopped following a tip-off from British intelligence, according to his upcoming autobiography.

title: Withholding Tax to be increased to 10%
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that the Withholding Tax will be increased from 5% to 10%.

title: Sri Lanka to allow vehicle imports from February 2025
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has announced that the government has decided to allow the import of vehicles for personal use, with effect from February 01, 2025.

title: Shots fired at drug trafficker’s house in Homagama
byline: A residence said to belong to a drug trafficker, located in the Ranaviru Gama area of Homagama, was shot at early this morning (18), Meegoda Police said.

title: Verdict on petitions over Grade 5 Scholarship Exam on Dec. 31
byline: The Supreme Court announced that the verdict on the fundamental rights petitions filed seeking an order to re-conduct the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, will be delivered on December 31, 2024.

title: Keheliya’s two bank accounts with Rs. 20 mln balance frozen
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has ordered to freeze two current and fixed deposit accounts belonging to former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella for a period of one week.
